channel.title: Need lots of help with noobscape/easyrsc
channel.description:
i've tryed java 1.4.2 java 5.0 update 18 java se 6.0 java sdk 7.0
all do not work im getting alot of java_home errors
exception in thread "main" java.long.noclass.deffounderror org/rscdeamon/client/mudclient
'taskkill' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
Enviromental variable java_homeC:\progam files\java\jre7\bin not defined "even though i changed my java_home system enviroment variable it still wants to use jre7? idk why!
build failed c:\users\mr. john myers\desktop\noobsscape v3\sever\build.xml:13: java.lang.unsupportedclassversionerror: Bad version number in .class
please any help would be great pm post email

item.title: Need lots of help with noobscape/easyrsc
item.dc:creator: @id4me22 id4me22
item.description:
@id4me22 wrote:

exception in thread main unsupportedclassversionerror: org/rscdeamon/client/mudclient (unsupported major.mino vresion 49.0)

this is only when i try to run the client after i’ve compiled it

im using this for the bat run client

@echo off
title NOOBscape
java -classpath rscd.jar;lib/xpp3.jar;lib/xstream.jar;lib/hex-string.jar;lib/jmf.jar .org.rsc.daemon.client.mudclient
pause

i think the problem is somwhere here “.org.rsc.daemon.client.mudclient” but im really not sure

also i’ve changed ip on my client form 127.0.0.1 to my ip but cannot figure out how to change the ip on the sever

also how to i change my ip in my sever folder and my client folder so i can allow others to login though my client ect ect ect not just use 127.0.0.1

got it to work i was compiling the bats with two different java versions soon thats what causes these problems

Read full topic
item.source: Need lots of help with noobscape/easyrsc

item.title: Need lots of help with noobscape/easyrsc
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk-6u27-download-440405.html
^ use that java

http://www.ecoficial.com/apachemirror//ant/binaries/apache-ant-1.8.2-bin.zip
^ install apache and set the environment variables. Check this http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,394071.0.html

You might need to edit the bat files, just open them with notepad. Good luck!

Read full topic
